result.execSummary:
Anthony L Freeman was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Anthony L Freeman was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L Freeman

records.addlTxt:
(2:37 PM case called.) Defendant Anthony L Freeman in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Anthony L Freeman. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
State advises this is an arraignment on Governor's Warrant. State advises has a copy of the Governor's Warrant.
Attorney Rivard advises has a copy of the Governor's Warrant and has gone over with the defendant.
Defendant advises true name is Anthony Freeman. 
Court has colloquy with the defendant regarding extradition case.
Defendant understands has the right to challenge the arrest.
Court and Attorney Rivard discuss with the defendant the Writ of Habeas Corpus rights.
(Off record to allow Attorney Rivard time to speak with the defendant.)
Defendant advised of right to an attorney and informed to contact Public Defender's Office in Minnesota.
Defendant advises he is Anthony Freeman and knows there is a warrant.
Court orders the defendant is remanded into custody and to be delivered to the State of Minnesota.
Court orders the District Attorney Office and law enforcement are to contact Minnesota to arrange pickup of the defendant.
Attorney Rivard makes record of defendant being incarcerated for court ordered 30 days which was extended as the State requested an additional 60 days and the Court ordered an additional 30 days. Attorney Rivard advises the defendant sat approximately 62 days and the defendant was then released due to passage of time. Attorney Rivard advises Minnesota was always aware the defendant was in custody, but didn't pickup the defendant.
Return on warrant on October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:03 AM cases 22CF782, 22CM589, 22CM843 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony L Freeman in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No further conditions ordered by the Court.

10:23 AM Cases called: 22CF782 & 22CM589. Defendant Anthony L Freeman in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Anthony L Freeman.  Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF782 - Extradition was not waived. Defendant is being held on a $2,500 cash bond.
22CM589 - Defendant was given a $500 signature bond and has refused to sign it.

Defense argues that defendant is being held unduly in 22CF782. At the last hearing, the Court only extended the commitment for 30 days; not the requested 60 days. State gives argument as to why the defendant should and can be held until 10/11/2022 at 9:30am. Court orders $2,500 cash bond be converted to a $2,500 signature bond.

9:34 AM cases 22CM589, 22CF782 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony L Freeman in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Anthony L Freeman. Attorney Rivard notes that he was recently appointed to the cases. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/19/2022 at 3:30 PM

Defense to schedule with Branch 1 in 22CF782 if requesting a hearing on bond.
Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:32 AM cases 22CF782, 22CM589 called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony L Freeman in court, in custody without counsel.
Court reviews defendant's right to an attorney. 

22CF782- Discussion held regarding Minnesota case and Governor's Warrant. Court orders defendant recommitted for 30 days. 

22CM589 to ride along.
Review hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, No Such Number, Unable to Forward
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, No Such Number, Unable to Forward

11:18am Cases called; 22CF782 & 22CM589 Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony L Freeman appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek. 

22CM589: Waives reading of the complaint and bond is set. 

22CF782: Defendant does not waive extradition. $2,500 cash bond is set.
Review hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cases called at 11:39 AM: 22CF782, 22CM589.
Defendant Anthony L Freeman not in court. Public Defender Intern Clayton Cavanaugh appeared via video from the jail with supervising Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Cavanaugh indicates the Defendant is refusing to appear today.
Court adjourns the matter to 7/14/22 at 11:00 AM.
